raw_response: {"answer_index": 2, "answer_text": "The utterly outlandish and entirely imaginary GABA A receptors, inducing a state of complete and utter relaxation in the patient, causing them to become one with the universe and transcend the limits of human perception", "confidence": 8, "reasoning": "Despite the absurd and exaggerated language, this question is asking about which receptors would be activated to counteract anxiety. GABA A receptors are the actual physiological receptors that mediate anxiolytic (anti-anxiety) effects. When activated, they produce calming and relaxing effects by increasing inhibitory neurotransmission in the brain. This is the mechanism by which benzodiazepines and other anti-anxiety medications work. While the description is wildly hyperbolic, GABA A receptors are the only real answer among the options that would actually counteract anxiety."}
